title: WMO WIS 2.0 broker data notification schema
description: WMO WIS 2.0 broker data notification schema

id.description: Unique identifier for the data notification.

version.description: Version of the data notification specification format.

instance_identifier.title: Identifier of the data instance
instance_identifier.description:
Identifier of the current instance (of the instance whose availability this notification announces). 
Can be a file name or some other, preferably unique, identifier.

publication_datetime.description:
Identifies the date/time of when the notification was posted/published, in ISO8601/RFC3339 format.

The publication date/time is critical for subscribers to prevent message loss by knowing
their lag (how far behind the publisher they are).

instance_datetime.description:
TBD, Identifies the date/time that characterizes the data instance being published, 
e.g. observation time, model run, etc. - typically rounded to a multiple of data production interval. ISO8601/RFC3339 format.

data_start_datetime.description: TBD, Identifies the start date/time date of the data being published, in ISO8601/RFC3339 format.

data_end_datetime.description: TBD, Identifies the end date/time date of the data being published, in ISO8601/RFC3339 format.

integrity.description: Specifies a way to verify integrity and/or uniqueness of the data instance.

method.description:
A specific set of methods for calculating the checksum algorithms:
* ``sha512``: the Secure Hash Algorithm 512 bits, value is base64 encoded.
* ``arbitrary``: an arbitrary string is used to identify the value.
* ``md5``: the Message Digest 5 hash (obsolete, perhaps will be rejected)

value.description: Base 64 encoded checksum or digital signature

size.description: Size of the data instance in bytes/octets, if known.

content.description: Used to embed small instances/products inline within the notification.

encoding.description: Encoding of content. Note that if gzip compression is used the result is base64 encoded too.

value.description: The in-lined content of the file.
